729432f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue
729432f-a.text:
Richmond Terrwce, east side, about 100 feet north of
heberton Avenue, at the N .E. corner of the Staten Island
Railroad tracks, showing the signal tower and buildings of the
Burlee lDry Dock Company.
May 22, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729432f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729433f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue
729433f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace (buildings thereon)w north side, between
Beberton and Richmond Avenues, showing the Jewett Works of
the National Lead Company. The view is from near the Staten
Island Railmoad tracks.
May 22, 1929
P. L. Sperr
N( REPRODUCTIORS
729433f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729498f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue
729498f-a.text:
1975 to 1967 Richmond Terrace, east side, at the
head of Heberton Avenue, and south from the Staten Island
Railroad tracks. The sign in the lunch room window (No. 1971)
reads: 'Full Gospel Mission, Church of God, all are welcome.'
May 22, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO RERODUCTIONS
729498f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729431f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue
729431f-b.text:
Richmond Terrace, at the S.W. corner of Heberton
Avenue. The real estate atlases from 1894 to 1917 show these
houses to be on the McSorley property.
July 2W, 1922
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The Heberton Avenue side of the old building.
November 4, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
